III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 03/24/24, a 9-year-old child was pulled into a room by an
unknown staff member. The child was subsequently spanked by
the staff member for acting out. The staff member utilized a belt to
administer the spanking. The child appeared to be screaming in
pain while being spanked.
Investigation MISACWIS indicates Complainant reported the allegation to
centralized intake on 3/26/24 at 6:33pm and left no contact
information.
Interviews:
I contacted Chief Administrator (CA) requesting a list of 9-year-old
children residing at the facility on 3/24/24. CA identified Youth R
as the only 9-year-old there.
I contacted Youth R’s Foster Care Worker and notified her of the
investigation assignment. She had no additional licensing
concerns to report.
I interviewed Government Worker 1. She said on 3/27/24, the
anonymous complainant re-contacted centralized intake, provided
a phone number, and asked that Government Worker 1 call her.
Government Worker 1 called the number and the Complainant
answered.
Complainant initially reported Youth R was spanked on 3/24/24 by
an unidentified staff. During her phone conversation with
Government Worker 1, she changed the date to 3/22/24 at around
7pm. and identified Supervisor as the person who hit the child with
a belt. Complainant could not or would not explain how she knew
Supervisor hit the child or how she knew a belt was used.
2

I interviewed Youth R jointly with Government Worker 1 on
3/28/24. He understood and complied with the rules of the
forensic interview. Youth R named a favorite staff person and
said there are no staff at the facility he dislikes. He denied he was
ever spanked or beaten by a staff or youth. Youth R added he
visited with his mother the day after the alleged spanking
occurred. Asked again, Youth R denied anything bad happened
to him at Wolverine Center and denied having any marks or
bruises on his body.
Supervisor did not show for his scheduled interview at the facility
on 4/9/24 at 2:00pm.
On 4/11/24 I interviewed Supervisor jointly with Government
Worker 1 via phone. He has worked at the facility for 22 years.
Supervisor denied taking Youth R to a room and hitting or
spanking him with a belt or anything else. He also denied ever
needing to physically restrain the child.
I interviewed Youth N jointly with Government Worker 1. He
described Supervisor as “nice” and someone who “doesn’t hurt
kids.”
I interviewed Youth Z jointly with Government Worker 1. He
described Supervisor as “a good staff who knows what he’s
doing.”
I interviewed Supervisor 2 jointly with Government Worker 1. She
denied seeing Supervisor spank any youth with a belt adding if
she had, she would have been mandated to report it.
Video:
Onsite Government Worker 1 and I reviewed video footage of the
second floor north residential hallway on 3/22/24 between 6:59pm
– 9:00pm. Supervisor was never seen on that floor during that
time period.
Documents reviewed:
Medical exams of Youth R dated 3/23/24 (the day after alleged
incident) and 4/2/24 indicated he had no injuries.
Government Worker 1 had no findings.
Analysis All evidence shows Supervisor did not spank or beat Youth R with
a belt or anything else.
3

Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
